Case reference: 2014006246.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1991, Jason O'Donaghey's roommate reported him missing as he had not been seen for 3 days. There were rumours that Jason left North Vancouver voluntarily, but his whereabouts are still unknown. He was a talented artist who may be making a living by selling aboriginal carvings.

Hair: Black, Long, Short on top, long at bottom
Shirt: Cotton, White, Dress shirt with longsleeve

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2018059815.CaseDesc: Leroy Custer was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, on August 30, 2018.

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin
Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011797.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1986, John Edwards was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, On left bicep

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2014003793.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1980, Keith Dufour was seen for the last time at his residence in the town of Amherstburg, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Forehead, Right temple on the forehead

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2022018788.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2022, Chi Tran was seen for the last time in Saint John, New Brunswick. Two years prior to his disappearance, Chi’s family moved to Canada from Vietnam, and he was enrolled at the University of New Brunswick. During the time of his disappearance, Chi was despondent.

Case reference: 2014003539.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2001, Jeffery McArthur was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. It is important to note that Jeffery suffers from a medical condition that affects his coordination, and balance. During the time of his disappearance, he may have been driving a 1993 white Mercury Topaz. The vehicle was subsequently located on September 2, 2001, in the west parking lot of Rundle Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001879.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Patrick Auger left his residence in Desmarais, Alberta, to travel to Slave Lake, Alberta. On November 1, 1983, Patrick was observed getting onto a Greyhound Bus bound for Peace River, Alberta, from Slave Lake.

Deformity: Right Fourth Toe, Deformed from previous fracture
Right Large Toe, Toe twisted from healed fracture

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2008002399.CaseDesc: David Manuel Hannah was last seen in Kingston, Ontario, on January 4, 1983. Mr. Hannah was employed as a prison guard at Millhaven Maximum Security Penitentiary in Kingston. His vehicle, a 1969 blue Delta 88, with Ontario licence plate SYM 921 has not been located.

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000085.CaseDesc: On April 17, 1994, Jose Fernandez was seen for the last time at his residence in the Villeray district in Montreal, Quebec. Following a disagreement, Jose left home in his car without saying where he was going. The vehicle was a red, 4-door Mercury Capri.

Case reference: 2019043636.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1994, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a well on agricultural land on rang du Côteau in St-Charles-sur-Richelieu, Quebec.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, 10K gold, wedding band, inscription "TNR ORA"
Belt: Leather, Black, With buckle, length 32 inches
Shirt: Cotton and polyester shirt with long sleeves, size 16-33

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2016061093.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1972, a female was found in Lake Erie, west of the Colchester light, east of the Detroit Channel, near the Town of Colchester, Ontario. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is believed to have been dead for 1-5 weeks.

Shoes: Brown, Loafers, made in Japan with 4 diamonds shape buttons on top, size 10
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Short sleeved, collar and round brass buttons

Case reference: 2013000082.CaseDesc: On April 26, 2011, Michel Petit was reported missing from his residence located in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. All his personal belongings were found in his apartment and his vehicle was parked in front of his home.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2014006384.CaseDesc: On January 7, 2014, at approximately 12:20 a.m., Yinghui Zhu was seen for the last time at her family’s restaurant in Toronto, Ontario. Yinghui was supposed to open the restaurant the next day but did not show up.

Coat: Black, Winter, Winter jacket; Brand: Lacoste

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2017014424.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2005, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in the South Glenmore Park in Calgary, Alberta. There were two key tags bearing the name “Jay” and a bible, with the name “Jay” written on the inside cover, that were found with the body.

Jeans: Denim, Blue, Medium coloured with fading

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: Calvin Simms told a friend that he was tired of living on the street and was thinking about jumping off a bridge. Mr. Simms has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014040212.CaseDesc: On October 24, 1991, Terry Patrick was seen for the last time at a motel in Pueblo, Colorado, USA. Terry was scheduled to go on a hunting trip with his friend on November 4, 1991, but never showed up.

Case reference: 2012003399.CaseDesc: Gregory Porter, 26, was last seen on October 5, 1984, when he was honourably discharged from the army at the Canadian Forces Base in Wainwright, Alberta. He had told people that he was going to British Columbia to drive a taxi. He was in good health both physically and mentally. The initial investigation revealed that Mr. Porter cashed a bank draft for $2400 on October 9, 1984, at a Royal Bank in Edmonton, Alberta. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016068411.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the body of a male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 35 years old, was found on the Lake Erie Country Club beach, Malden Township, Essex County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he had been in the water for 5-7 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and he may have worn a lower denture.
Underwear: White, "Fruit of the Loom" brand, size 30

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2008003199.CaseDesc: Police received information that Toivo Reinikainen had not returned to work at the Great West Timber Camp on the Deadhorse Road in Walsh Twp (northern Ontario).  He had been observed on site on September 26, 1984 at 4:00 a.m. by his co-workers.  The camp location is a relatively remote area, access is by Deadhorse Road which is open to the public.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2006009399.CaseDesc: Patrick Ukrainetz departed his mother's house in St. Isidore, Ontario which he did periodically, but always returned.  On December 26, 2001, Mr. Ukrainetz was captured on a video surveillance camera at a bank in St. Sauveur, in the Province of Quebec. There has not been any other activity on the bank account since that time and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004566.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1981, at approximately 5:00pm, Dennis Krioul was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Dennis’ wife states that he was in some business trouble and he had a warrant out for his arrest for fraud.

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Ms. Abigosis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. M. Abigosis was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2014001998.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1985, Maxime Morais accompanied Pierre Beaulieu as they left the City of Montreal, Quebec in Pierre's vehicle, a 1980 orange convertible MG, and traveled to the municipality of Rawdon. They never came back home.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2014001355.CaseDesc: Mr. Aurèle Massey was last seen on August 8, 1983 in Montreal. He left his residence to have his vehicle repaired, but never returned. Mr. Massey was despondent and had mentioned that he wanted to jump into the Soulanges Canal.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm , circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2006005799.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1993, the right foot of an adult, washed ashore on the south side of Pelee Island, which is in Lake Erie, Ontario. The foot was contained in a white cotton sock and an LA Gear running shoe, size 8. A search of the area failed to locate any other remains. There is limited information available on this case.

Shoes: High top running shoe, "L.A. Gear" brand, size 8

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White
Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2022048901.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2021, at approximately 7:33 a.m., Madison Roy-Boudreau was seen for the last time when she was picked up in a vehicle driven by a man at the corner of Assaff and Grange Streets in Bathurst, New Brunswick. Madison has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014002336.CaseDesc: On March 22, 1993, Yolande Bouchard was going to meet her sister at the mall in Trois-Rivières at 4:00 p.m. She never arrived and was reported missing at that time. Her car was later found in Trois-Rivières Ouest with two offence tickets on the windshield.

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2014001522.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1977, James Stackhouse and a friend were camped on a small island on the east shore of Lake Winnipeg, north of Hole River where they were doing some mapping. Their boat drifted away to the south towards Deer Island located 3 miles south. At approximately 6:00 p.m. both men left the shore holding onto some small logs that they had tied together with their belts. They attempted to swim to Deer Island but the current and the waves carried them to 1/4 mile east of Deer Island. The bundle of logs that they had tied broke and the men were separated. Mr. Stackhouse's friend managed to swim to Deer Island but he did not see Mr. Stackhouse again. Searches of the area were done by land, air and water but the body of Mr. Stackhouse was not recovered. He is presumed deceased due to drowning.

Case reference: 2016003652.CaseDesc: Shelley Desrochers was last seen on January 2, 2016 in London (ON). Police and family are concerned for her well being.

Other:
Cell Phone, Lost cell phone 
BLACK ZTE GRAND X2 Z850
S# 867239025096526 & SS 326E52104380
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Rose, Heart & blue bird

Case reference: 2021023515.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2015, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area on Vincent Massey Road in Rawdon, Quebec. Anthropological analysis suggests that he was of Caucasian descent, between the ages of 16 and 25, and that he had died between 1990 and 2010.

Sweater: Grey, Hooded Sweatshirt, Nike brand, size XXL
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Upper Arm, Possible previous injury to left humerus bone

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2006018499.CaseDesc: Tony Gikoff was last seen July 9, 1955, near Colborne, Ontario, at a property he rented to tenants. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004546.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2004, Roy Lewis was last seen hitchhiking in Sackville, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2018016431.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, Crystal Hackett was seen for the last time in Lloydminster, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Crystal may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Jaw, Thin white scar on the right side of jaw

Case reference: 2014005155.CaseDesc: Harold Murray Harvey was seen for the last time by a neighbour in front of his residence in Pincourt on September 14, 2008. Mr. Harvey was reported missing by a family member on September 19, 2008. At the time of his disappearance he was taking medication, which he left behind. Mr. Harvey had left his home a few times in the past but always returned after a couple of days.

Case reference: 2020043711.CaseDesc: Alfred L'Arrivee was last seen on May 3, 1973 at a rural property where he resided in Keg River, Alberta. Alfred has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006005599.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1980, Foster Bezanson departed the Abitibi Road 48 area near Cochrane, Ontario to go hunting.  Mr. Bezanson failed to return and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020048.CaseDesc: Kathleen Johnston went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 2:15 p.m. on October 20, 1953. Miss Johnston got off of a city transit bus on her way to work at the Gem Café in the downtown area after visiting her mother at her residence.

Case reference: 2022027245.CaseDesc: Anne Lenning was last seen in December, 1992, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006708.CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2015017945.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1995, fishermen saw a man's body in the waters of the Prairie River near Gagné Island. According to experts the approximate time of death would be from a few days to a week.

Shoes: Black, only one shoe found; size 10EEE

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham.

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Scar: Genitals, may have a surgical scar from a twisted testicle operation

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2019061160.CaseDesc: The body of this young to middle-aged male was found in September 2019 near Merritt, British Columbia. He had brown hair, a muscular build and no obvious scars or tattoos. The RCMP are investigating this as a suspicious death.

Sweater: Cloth, Brown, “Brunella Gori” brand with hood

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014003039.CaseDesc: Réal Généreux was last seen on October 20, 1980, in Montreal. He was a taxi driver and was known to frequent a tavern on Mont-Royal Street. Following an accident, Réal had difficulty walking due to pain he had in his spine.

Case reference: 2014005240.CaseDesc: Mr.Utinowatum was last seen on April 6, 2002 at 9:00pm in the area of Beaver Ranch, Alberta, near Fort Vermilion. Mr. Utinowatum wandered off from a residence after visiting family in the area.  Mr.Utinowatum has not been seen or heard from since. Mr.Utinowatum suffered from alcohol addiction problems.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005033.CaseDesc: On April 28, 2000, at approximately 9:45 a.m., Kim Mezo was seen for the last time as she left the Branson Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2019050899.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1975, the remains of an elderly man of a small stature were found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He is believed to have died of a drug overdose approximately a week before he was found.

Case reference: 2021008284.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020, this young to middle-aged Caucasian woman died in a car accident on Trans-Canada Highway 1 near Chilliwack, BC. She wore blue nail polish and had no tattoos on her lower back, abdomen or legs. She had an upper denture and her lower teeth were in poor condition.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up in the morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. He left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Mr. Ilkay was last seen in Moncton downtown area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes
